title: 2001 Florida Marlins season
text:
The Florida Marlins' 2001 season was the ninth season for the <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> (MLB) franchise in the National League. It would begin with the team attempting to improve on their season from 2000. Their managers were <a href="John%20Boles%2C%20Jr.">John Boles</a> and <a href="Tony%20P%C3%A9rez">Tony Pérez</a>. They played home games at <a href="Pro%20Player%20Stadium">Pro Player Stadium</a>. They finished with a record of 76-86, 4th in the <a href="National%20League%20East">National League East</a>.
Regular season.
Notable transactions.
April 9, 2001: John Mabry was sent to the Florida Marlins by the St. Louis Cardinals as part of a conditional deal.
Citrus Series.
The annual <a href="Interleague%20play">interleague</a> games between the Florida Marlins and the Tampa Bay Devil Rays were played in June and July. They are known as the <a href="Citrus%20Series">Citrus Series</a>. The Marlins won the series 4-2.
